title: Forward deleting a whole word in MacOS jumps the cursor back
content:
With the newer versions of Thunderbird running in MacOS 14, starting around version 115 but I am not sure when it started exactly, when I create a message, then double-click on a word and push the forward delete key ("delete" on the keyboard), the first push will delete the whole word (and the preceding space), but also jump the cursor backwards in the text. So if I push "delete" again, some other area of the text will be deleted. See attached images, recorded in Thunderbird in "Troubleshoot mode" to make sure all add-ons were disabled (and in version 115.4.3). I believe the cursor moves backwards by a number of characters equal to the number of characters deleted.

When I use the "backspace" key, the cursor moves back by one (i.e. it stays in place once the word and preceding space are deleted). Also, if I double-click a word, erase it, then command-Z to undo (erased word remains highlighted) then forward delete, this time it will correctly delete the highlighted word and leave the cursor in place (but no extra space before is deleted).

I would like to use the "delete" key in situations where I need to delete a portion of text. Double-clicking on the first word to delete is very quick, then I hit delete multiple times to erase all I want, I find this faster than click, drag to highlight all the text I want to erase and no more, then delete. But with the cursor jumping back, it messes up my text and I need to re-type.

I have not tested the latest Thunderbird in a Windows environment. I know MacOS keyboards do not have naturally a forward delete key, but with an external USB keyboard, we can get that easily.

Is this something others have experienced? I could not find anything similar with a quick search in the support section.
creator: vincent41

title: Thuderbird & Google Calendar - Cancled Meetings not processed in Tbird
content:
Using Thunderbird 115.4.3 (64 Bit).

I have my local Thunderbird calendar synced with Google Calendar. When I receive a meeting cancellation for a single meeting in a series of recurring dates, the cancellation does not get processed.

Even if I select the event in Thunderbird and choose to delete the single event (as opposed to all occurrences) in Thunderbird, the event does not get deleted.

In order to remove the event from the calendar, I have to go to Google calendar and delete it there. After the resync, it is finally removed from the Thunderbird calendar.

Is this a bug or am I missing something?

title: Connecting Thunderbird to new internet provider
content: I live out in the country now. I have the only internet provider who comes out here - Frontier.com. They do not give an email address to new customers. So I do NOT have an email ending with @frontier.com to set up the connection to my new internet provider via Thunderbird. I've tried every possible configuration to try to get Thunderbird to connect without an actual @frontier.com email address. Frontier wanted me to use an already present att email with them. But obviously Thunderbird knows I don't have an att account!! So how the heck do I get Thunderbird to connect to my internet without an @frontier.com email!!!!???? I have manually configured the settings over and over with different emails trying to get it to connect without any luck. I have spent days on this. I have talked to Frontier many times and been hung up on when I get to the obvious question of how can I connect to the internet in my email program without an @frontier.com email. I am afraid that I will have to try some other program to be able to get my emails..... but I don't want to!!

title: Message list pane height
content:
The message list pane can not be reduced below 10 messages, and the header area height is too much, also. My wife was happy with the amount email content she could see previously, but hates the new version.

The message list size issue is known since July (four months!). It depends on a single number in the code, and yet this number has not been changed. My confidence in the Thunderbird team is badly shaken by something so irritating to so many, so easy to change, and still has not been changed.

We both want to know when these issues will be corrected. I want to avoid the hassle and effort to teach her to use Outlook, so please tell me if the change is going to happen before December!

title: IMAP folders for GMail labels
content:
Hello.

I've read some articles about the way Thunderbird works with GMail IMAP folders. If I understand well, TB creates a copy of every GMail messages for each assigned label. If multiple copy of messages are done depending on assigned labels (all messages, sent messages, about 20 custom labels, and so on), does it mean that I'd need 50 or 60 GB or more to synchronize my GMail account ?

Thanks for your help.

Regards.

title: Roll back from 115.4.3 just a little (earlier 115)?
content:
As everyone here knows, Thunderbird 115 is a hot mess; sadly, as they cycle through new releases, it sometimes gets worse, not better. It appears from my update history that 115.2.3 was the most stable of the 115 versions. I'd rather go back to 102 but it seems that the profile was modified in 115 so that it is no longer compatible with 102. Thus a 102 rollback might require quite a bit of work to reimport the profile into a clean install. And I have gigabytes of important mail.

I'm not on 115.4.3 and it is close to unusable, as they screwed up regression in a major bug, and my bugzilla on it has sat unanswered, other than requesting I be nice to the devs. So as a lower-risk option might be to roll back from 115.4.3 to 115.2.3. Has anyone tried anything like that, or know the safest way? I don't know what booby traps they've planted to prevent any rollbacks. Thanks!
creator: fred37
